ranks.effect: Advantage on sneak checks relying on sight, passive sneak increases by 3
Advantage on sneak checks relying on sound, passive sneak increases by 3
While in dim light, you become shadowed, passive sneak increases by 3
Load reduced by 5, Strength requirement reduced by 1, DT reduced by 1
Load reduced by 10 (minimum of 3)
If you spend at least 4 AP on your turn to move, you can move an additional 10 feet
When taking damage from an area of effect, your DT is doubled
Your maximum stamina points increase by a number equal to your level
Advantage on combat sequence rolls (if already have advantage, gain +5)
Radiation DC decreases by 2
Radiation DC decreases by 2
Radiation DC decreases by 2
When taking damage from a critical hit, your DT increases by 3
When taking damage from a critical hit, your DT increases by 5
If you would gain a severe injury, you instead gain a random limb condition
Ignores negative effects of the first 2 levels of decay for the armor
Ignores negative effects of the first 4 levels of decay for the armor
Armor no longer decays from being damaged by a critical hit
Carry load increased by 10
Carry load increased by 15
Carry load increased by 25
+1 bonus to DT
+1 bonus to DT
+2 bonus to DT
+1 bonus to AC
+1 bonus to AC
+1 bonus to AC
Reduce explosive damage taken by 5
Reduce explosive damage taken by 10
Reduce explosive damage taken by 15
Reduce laser and plasma damage taken by 5
Reduce laser and plasma damage taken by 5
Reduce laser and plasma damage taken by 10
If you start your turn with less than half your hit points, you can spend 1 AP to move 10 feet
If you start your turn with less than half your hit points, your DT increases by 5 (only for damage against HP)
You gain an additional AP at the start of your turn for each level of decay the power armor gained since your last turn
Spend 3 AP to activate/deactivate. Each creature within 10 feet takes 1d6 electricity damage when activated and at the start of their turns. Removes 10 minutes from allotted time per round active
Electricity damage increases by 1d6. Removes an additional 5 minutes from allotted time per round active
Electricity damage increases by 2d6. Removes an additional 10 minutes from allotted time per round active
When taking damage from a melee attack, the attacker takes a quarter (rounded down) of the damage they dealt
The attacker takes another quarter (rounded down) of the damage they dealt (effectively half of the total)
When taking damage from a melee attack, the attacker is knocked back by 15 feet
Spending more than 18 AP on your turn causes overheating instead of 15
Spending more than 20 AP on your turn causes overheating instead of 15
Overheating requires 15 minutes of allotted time loss instead of 30
You can spend 1 AP on your turn to fly 5 feet upwards
Passive sense increases by 5
Passive sense increases by 5
Passive sense increases by 10
Whenever you make a targeted attack roll, reduce the additional AP cost by 1
Whenever you make a targeted attack roll, reduce the additional AP cost by 1
If you can see a creature, you can spend 6 AP on your turn to learn its HP total, SP total, AC, or DT
If you can see a creature, you can spend 3 AP to mark it (one marked creature at a time). When dealing damage to a marked creature, you deal an additional die of damage
You can mark up to two more creatures
When dealing damage to a marked creature, you deal an additional die of damage
Spend 1 AP to turn on headlamp (bright light in a 40-foot cone, dim light for an additional 40 feet)
Bright and dim light both shine an additional 10 feet
Bright and dim light both shine an additional 10 feet. If turned on in darkness, creatures within 5 feet become blinded for one round
If you hit a creature with an unarmed attack, they bleed
Spend 6 AP to make a powerful unarmed attack (2d6 bludgeoning damage)
Damage increases by 1d6
Damage increases by 1d6 and pushes targets 15 feet back
Carry Load increases by 15
Carry Load increases by 15
Carry Load increases by 20
While overheated, your maximum AP increases by 2, you have advantage on all attack rolls, you can move 15 feet with 1 AP, and your unarmed attacks deal an additional 3d6 fire damage
You can spend 3 AP to overheat the fusion core
Your maximum AP increases by 2

If you fall at least 15 feet, upon hitting the ground you can activate this upgrade. Each creature within 20 feet takes 3d6 fire damage and 3d6 explosive damage. Removes 20 minutes from allotted time per activation
Fire and explosive damage each increase by 1d6
Radius increases by 10 feet

Power Armor Upgrades.name: Super Mutant Fitting
Power Armor Upgrades.effect: The armor is modified for a Super Mutant. Humans and Ghouls cannot use it. Removing this upgrade costs the same price or crafting materials as adding it

Ranged Weapons.name: Flamer
Ranged Weapons.range: 60 ft. line, 10 ft. wide, or 20 ft. cone

Ranged Weapons.name: Fat-Man
Ranged Weapons.damage: 12d10 explosive in a 30 ft. radius and two levels of radiation in a 60 ft. radius

Ranged Weapon Modifications.name: Auto-Firing Turret
Ranged Weapon Modifications.description: Weapon mounts to immovable stand, automatically aims using AI. Must be wired to terminal. Designate non-targets. Costs 6 AP to activate/deactivate from terminal. Turret rolls combat sequence (bonus = Intelligence modifier), gains 10 AP on its turn to attack closest target in short range. Turret is a robot with 25 HP, 10 AC. If to 0 HP, ceases function, weapon gains 1 decay
Ranged Weapon Modifications.equippable_weapons: Any weapon

Ranged Weapon Modifications.name: Bayonet
Ranged Weapon Modifications.description: Attach knife or combat knife to front of weapon. Can attack with knife without switching weapons
Ranged Weapon Modifications.equippable_weapons: Any ranged weapon with the Two Handed property

Ranged Weapon Modifications.name: Boosted Capacitor
Ranged Weapon Modifications.time_to_equip_unequip: 60 - (5 x your Intelligence score) in minutes
Ranged Weapon Modifications.description: Enhanced power consumption. Spend 2 rounds of ammo instead of 1 to increase damage by 2
Ranged Weapon Modifications.equippable_weapons: Any energy weapon (cannot have overclocked capacitor)

Ranged Weapon Modifications.name: Double Action
Ranged Weapon Modifications.description: Revolver trigger mechanism upgrade fires round and cocks hammer simultaneously. Costs 1 less AP to attack (min 1)
Ranged Weapon Modifications.equippable_weapons: Any revolver

Ranged Weapon Modifications.name: Ergonomic Grip
Ranged Weapon Modifications.description: Improved grip, handling, and design. Weapon’s critical hit damage modifier or damage dice increases by 1
Ranged Weapon Modifications.equippable_weapons: Any weapon

Ranged Weapon Modifications.name: Hardened Receiver
Ranged Weapon Modifications.time_to_equip_unequip: 60 - (5 x your Intelligence score) in minutes
Ranged Weapon Modifications.description: Improvement to firing mechanism to increase projectile power. Weapon gains Destructive and Powerful. If already Destructive, damage dice rank increases once (max d12). Load increases by 2
Ranged Weapon Modifications.equippable_weapons: Any handgun, submachine gun, rifle, or shotgun (cannot have Light Build)

Ranged Weapon Modifications.name: Holographic Weapon Sight
Ranged Weapon Modifications.description: Holographic reticle on non-magnifying sight. Attack roll total increases by 1. Load increases by 1
Ranged Weapon Modifications.equippable_weapons: Any ranged weapon (cannot have Scope or Infrared Scope)

Ranged Weapon Modifications.name: Improved Rifling
Ranged Weapon Modifications.time_to_equip_unequip: 60 - (5 x your Intelligence score) in minutes
Ranged Weapon Modifications.description: Upgrade to barrel grooves. Range modifiers increase by half
Ranged Weapon Modifications.equippable_weapons: Any handgun, submachine gun, or rifle (except Flare Gun, H&H Tools nail gun, or Railway Rifle)

Ranged Weapon Modifications.name: Increased Clip Size
Ranged Weapon Modifications.description: Longer, larger clip for more rounds. Rounds increase by 3
Ranged Weapon Modifications.equippable_weapons: Any handgun, submachine gun, rifle, or shotgun that does not have Manual Reload or Quick Reload

Ranged Weapon Modifications.name: Infrared Scope
Ranged Weapon Modifications.description: Pre-war thermal imaging sight. Long range modifier triples. Can target hidden, shrouded, dark, or invisible creatures (not behind full cover). Attack rolls increase by 2. Load increases by 2
Ranged Weapon Modifications.equippable_weapons: Any revolver or rifle (including Laser Rifle, Plasma Rifle, or Gauss Rifle). Cannot have Scope or Holographic weapon sight

Ranged Weapon Modifications.name: Laser Sight
Ranged Weapon Modifications.description: Projects beam onto targets, providing visual reference. Weapon gains Accurate. If already Accurate, critical hit damage doubles. Load increases by 1
Ranged Weapon Modifications.equippable_weapons: Any handgun, rifle, or energy weapon (except Tri-Beam Laser Rifle, Multiplas Rifle, or Gatling Laser)

Ranged Weapon Modifications.name: Light Build
Ranged Weapon Modifications.time_to_equip_unequip: 60 - (5 x your Intelligence score) in minutes
Ranged Weapon Modifications.description: Lighter materials for rebalance and ease of operation. Load decreases by half. Strength requirement decreases by 1. Weapon gains Breakable
Ranged Weapon Modifications.equippable_weapons: Any weapon (cannot be Strengthened)

Ranged Weapon Modifications.name: Longer Barrel
Ranged Weapon Modifications.description: Increased barrel length for more range, poorer short range. Long range modifier increases by 10. Short range modifier decreases by 2. Load increases by 4
Ranged Weapon Modifications.equippable_weapons: Any handgun, rifle, or energy weapon

Ranged Weapon Modifications.name: Lucky Charm
Ranged Weapon Modifications.description: Personalized attachment. Critical hit chance decreases by 1
Ranged Weapon Modifications.equippable_weapons: Any weapon

Ranged Weapon Modifications.name: Muzzle Brake
Ranged Weapon Modifications.description: Redirects propellant gases to reduce recoil and muzzle rise. Attack roll total increases by 1. Strength requirement decreases by 1. Load increases by 2
Ranged Weapon Modifications.equippable_weapons: Any handgun, submachine gun, rifle, or shotgun (except Flare Gun, H&H Tools nail gun, or Railway Rifle)

Ranged Weapon Modifications.name: On-Board Target Tracking
Ranged Weapon Modifications.description: Gyroscopic muzzle synchronized with sights and AI for target locking and improved aim. Before attack, spend 6 AP to mark target creature within short range. Attack rolls against marked creature have advantage
Ranged Weapon Modifications.equippable_weapons: Any energy weapon (except Gauss rifle, Gauss pistol, or Gatling Gun)

Ranged Weapon Modifications.name: Overclocked Capacitor
Ranged Weapon Modifications.time_to_equip_unequip: 60 - (5 x your Intelligence score) in minutes
Ranged Weapon Modifications.description: Further power consumption improvements. Spend 3 rounds of ammo instead of 1 to increase damage by 4
Ranged Weapon Modifications.equippable_weapons: Any energy weapon that doesn’t have automatic or charge (cannot have boosted capacitor)

Ranged Weapon Modifications.name: Remote Controlled Turret
Ranged Weapon Modifications.description: Weapon mounts to immovable stand. Aims based on your input from a nearby terminal. Must be wired to terminal. Costs 6 AP to activate/deactivate. Can spend AP to attack with mounted weapon (AP cost reduced by 2, min 3). If Intelligence is less than weapon's Strength requirement, disadvantage on attack rolls. Turret is a robot with 25 HP, 10 AC. If to 0 HP, ceases function, weapon gains 1 decay
Ranged Weapon Modifications.equippable_weapons: Any weapon

Ranged Weapon Modifications.name: Scope
Ranged Weapon Modifications.description: Simple glass scope for distant magnification. If weapon already has a scope, magnification increases. Long range modifier quadrupled. Load increases by 2
Ranged Weapon Modifications.equippable_weapons: Any revolver or rifle. Laser Rifle, Plasma Rifle, or Gauss Rifle. Cannot have Infrared Scope or Holographic weapon sight

Ranged Weapon Modifications.name: Semi-Automatic
Ranged Weapon Modifications.time_to_equip_unequip: 60 - (5 x your Intelligence score) in minutes
Ranged Weapon Modifications.description: Overhaul of firing mechanism for quicker round loading. Weapon gains Semi-Automatic
Ranged Weapon Modifications.equippable_weapons: Any weapon that doesn’t have Manual Reload, Quick Reload, Automatic, Area of Effect, or Energy Weapon

Ranged Weapon Modifications.name: Silencer
Ranged Weapon Modifications.description: Muzzle device reducing acoustic intensity. While hidden, attack rolls with silencer don't reveal presence (except to attacked creature). Load increases by 2. Damage dice rank decreases once (min d4)
Ranged Weapon Modifications.equippable_weapons: Any handgun, submachine gun, rifle, or shotgun (except Flare Gun, H&H Tools nail gun, or Railway Rifle)

Ranged Weapon Modifications.name: Speedloader
Ranged Weapon Modifications.description: Device for loading multiple chambers of a revolver simultaneously. Can reload with 4 AP
Ranged Weapon Modifications.equippable_weapons: Any revolver

Ranged Weapon Modifications.name: Stock
Ranged Weapon Modifications.description: Added back portion for structural support. Improves existing stock. Attack roll total increases by 1. Load increases by 4
Ranged Weapon Modifications.equippable_weapons: Any submachine gun, rifle, shotgun, energy weapon, or revolver with long barrel mod

Ranged Weapon Modifications.name: Strengthen
Ranged Weapon Modifications.time_to_equip_unequip: 60 - (5 x your Intelligence score) in minutes
Ranged Weapon Modifications.description: Reinforces weapon structure, improves mechanisms. Weapon gains Sturdy and Defensive. Load increases by 2
Ranged Weapon Modifications.equippable_weapons: Any weapon (cannot have Light Build)

Placed Explosives.name: Nuke Mine
Placed Explosives.damage: 12d10 explosive and two levels of rads

Weapon Properties.name: Accurate
Weapon Properties.description: Increases the weapon's attack roll accuracy, typically granting a bonus to hit or enhancing critical hit potential (exact effect specified in modifications like Laser Sight).

Weapon Properties.name: Ammo and Depleted
Weapon Properties.description: Requires specific ammunition or fuel to deal listed damage. Without ammo, deals 'Depleted' damage. Reloading costs 6 AP.

Weapon Properties.name: Applies bleeding
Weapon Properties.description: When dealing HP damage, the target gains the Bleeding condition, causing ongoing damage.

Weapon Properties.name: Applies burning
Weapon Properties.description: When dealing HP damage, the target gains the Burning condition, causing ongoing fire damage.

Weapon Properties.name: Applies dazed
Weapon Properties.description: When dealing HP damage, the target gains the Dazed condition, affecting their actions or reactions.

Weapon Properties.name: Applies slowed
Weapon Properties.description: When dealing HP damage, the target gains the Slowed condition, reducing their movement or actions until the end of their next turn.

Weapon Properties.name: Arc
Weapon Properties.description: The weapon's attack can arc to additional targets within a specified range, dealing damage to multiple enemies.

Weapon Properties.name: Area of Effect
Weapon Properties.description: The weapon affects all creatures and objects within a specified radius or shape, dealing damage to multiple targets.

Weapon Properties.name: Automatic: X
Weapon Properties.description: Allows multiple attacks in a single action, with the number of attacks specified by X (e.g., Automatic: 2 allows 2 attacks).

Weapon Properties.name: Blinding
Weapon Properties.description: Creatures in the listed area of effect become blinded for (4 - Endurance modifier) rounds (minimum 1).

Weapon Properties.name: Breakable
Weapon Properties.description: The weapon gains 1 level of decay on an attack roll of 3 or lower.

Weapon Properties.name: Charge
Weapon Properties.description: The weapon requires charging before firing, typically increasing damage or requiring additional AP.

Weapon Properties.name: Clasp
Weapon Properties.description: When dealing HP damage, the weapon clamps onto the target, grappling them and imposing disadvantage on Strength or Agility checks to escape. Cannot grapple creatures two or more size categories larger, and one size category larger only if your Strength is 10.

Weapon Properties.name: Cleave
Weapon Properties.description: Spend 3 additional AP to target two extra areas within 5 feet of the previous. Each creature in these areas is attacked. If one creature occupies multiple areas, they are targeted by each attack. 'Always cleaves' means no extra AP cost.

Weapon Properties.name: Deafening
Weapon Properties.description: Creatures in the listed area of effect become deafened for (4 - Endurance modifier) rounds (minimum 1).

Weapon Properties.name: Debilitating
Weapon Properties.description: When dealing HP damage from a targeted attack, roll twice on the conditions table and apply both. Stacking if the same condition is rolled twice.

Weapon Properties.name: Defensive
Weapon Properties.description: DT increases by 2 when blocking while holding this weapon.

Weapon Properties.name: Destructive
Weapon Properties.description: When rolling a 1 on the damage dice, it is treated as a 2 instead.

Weapon Properties.name: Detonator
Weapon Properties.description: The explosive does not detonate after the allotted time. Spend 3 AP on your turn to detonate within the noted range.

Weapon Properties.name: Dismember
Weapon Properties.description: When dealing HP damage, the target gains a random arm or leg condition. If brought to 0 HP, you can choose to sever their head or a limb.

Weapon Properties.name: Durable
Weapon Properties.description: The weapon does not decay from being thrown or from rolling a 1 on an attack roll.

Weapon Properties.name: Electromagnetic
Weapon Properties.description: Damage is doubled for robots, synths, or inorganic creatures.

Weapon Properties.name: Energy Weapon
Weapon Properties.description: The weapon uses energy-based ammunition (e.g., laser, plasma, or electricity), often with unique effects or ammo types.

Weapon Properties.name: Fragile
Weapon Properties.description: The weapon breaks and ceases function when it gains a level of decay.

Weapon Properties.name: Freezing
Weapon Properties.description: The target gains the Slowed condition until the end of their next turn.

Weapon Properties.name: Incendiary
Weapon Properties.description: The target gains the Burning condition, causing ongoing fire damage.

Weapon Properties.name: Kickback
Weapon Properties.description: The weapon has significant recoil, potentially affecting accuracy or requiring higher Strength to wield effectively.

Weapon Properties.name: Mangle
Weapon Properties.description: When dealing HP damage, the target gains the Bleeding condition.

Weapon Properties.name: Manual Reload
Weapon Properties.description: The weapon requires a full action to reload, typically costing 6 AP.

Weapon Properties.name: Powerful
Weapon Properties.description: The weapon deals increased damage or has enhanced effects on critical hits.

Weapon Properties.name: Proximity
Weapon Properties.description: The explosive does not detonate after the allotted time. It detonates at the end of a creature's turn when they first enter its 10-foot proximity area.

Weapon Properties.name: Quick Reload
Weapon Properties.description: The weapon can be reloaded faster than normal, typically reducing the AP cost for reloading.

Weapon Properties.name: Radioactive
Weapon Properties.description: The weapon deals radiation damage, potentially causing radiation-based effects or conditions.

Weapon Properties.name: Reach
Weapon Properties.description: The weapon's range increases by 5 feet.

Weapon Properties.name: Revitalizing
Weapon Properties.description: Spend 6 AP to target a dying creature, which then gains 1 hit point.

Weapon Properties.name: Shattering
Weapon Properties.description: The explosive always detonates at the end of your turn, regardless of the explosive roll.

Weapon Properties.name: Slow
Weapon Properties.description: The weapon or explosive does not hit or detonate until the start of your next turn. Misses if the target is out of range.

Weapon Properties.name: Slow Reload
Weapon Properties.description: Reloading the weapon takes longer than normal, often requiring additional AP or time.

Weapon Properties.name: Smoke
Weapon Properties.description: Creates a heavily obscured cloud of smoke that spreads around corners and blinds creatures within, lasting 1 minute.

Weapon Properties.name: Spread
Weapon Properties.description: The weapon's attack affects a wider area, increasing the chance to hit multiple targets or reducing accuracy penalties at close range.

Weapon Properties.name: Sturdy
Weapon Properties.description: The weapon does not decay if thrown and ignores negative effects of the first 2 levels of decay.

Weapon Properties.name: Thrown
Weapon Properties.description: The weapon can be thrown a distance equal to your Strength score multiplied by the listed numbers (base/long range). Attacks at long range have disadvantage.

Weapon Properties.name: Two Handed
Weapon Properties.description: Attacking with one hand incurs disadvantage unless 2 additional AP are spent. Alternatively, if Strength is at least 3 greater than the requirement, it can be wielded with one hand without disadvantage.

Weapon Properties.name: Unarmed
Weapon Properties.description: Uses the Unarmed skill bonus for attack rolls instead of the Melee Weapons skill bonus.

Weapon Properties.name: Unstable
Weapon Properties.description: The weapon is prone to malfunctions or has unpredictable performance, potentially affecting reliability or causing decay.

Weapon Properties.name: Weighted
Weapon Properties.description: If you roll a 1 on the damage dice, it becomes a 2 instead.

Rarity.condition: Extremely rare or lost crafting materials/blueprints
Somewhat difficult to acquire or high demand
Limited stock, sentimental value, or above average
Easy to find, surplus, or bartering
Bountiful, low value, or functionally broken

Decay Discount.effect: For every level of decay, price decreases by 10%

Other Equipment.name: Bag, Backpack
Other Equipment.description: A leather, burlap, or cloth bag with straps that increases your carry load by 50 while worn.

Other Equipment.name: Bag, Camping Backpack
Other Equipment.description: A large, heavy-duty backpack with nylon strings, waist belt, many pockets, and an overhead compartment. Increases carry load by 100 while worn.

Other Equipment.name: Bag, Range
Other Equipment.description: A single bag with one sling, designed to store up to three two-handed or unwieldy weapons, halving their carry load.

Other Equipment.name: Bandolier
Other Equipment.description: A pocketed strap worn across the body, increases carry load by 25. Not considered a bag, can be worn with a backpack without encumbrance.

Other Equipment.name: Ball Bearings
Other Equipment.description: Small metal spheres scattered in a 5-foot radius for 3 AP. Creatures moving through fall prone and take 1d4 impact damage unless passive sense > 15 or noticed, then spend 2 AP per 5 feet.

Other Equipment.name: Bear Trap
Other Equipment.description: Armed in a 5-foot area for 6 AP. Triggers deal 3d4 piercing damage and grapple. Reset with 6 AP and Strength check (DC 15). Disarm with 6 AP and crafting check (DC 15). Prying open requires 6 AP and Strength check (DC 15, disadvantage if grappled unless Endurance ≥ 6).

Other Equipment.name: Binoculars
Other Equipment.description: Magnifies sight for 3 AP, granting advantage on Perception checks for objects/creatures/locations ≥ 100 feet away.

Other Equipment.name: Caltrops
Other Equipment.description: Sharp objects scattered in a 5-foot radius for 3 AP. Creatures moving through take 2 piercing damage per foot (not reduced by DT) unless passive sense > 15 or noticed, then spend 2 AP per 5 feet.

Other Equipment.name: Canteen
Other Equipment.description: Metal container holding 32 oz. of liquid.

Other Equipment.name: Chain
Other Equipment.description: Grants advantage on Strength rolls to grapple/strangle. AC 10, DT 10, 10 HP, vulnerable to ballistic, laser, plasma damage.

Other Equipment.name: Electronic Lockpick
Other Equipment.description: Attaches to a lock within 5 feet for 6 AP, opens at end of turn, breaks after one use.

Other Equipment.name: Electronic Lockpick Mk II
Other Equipment.description: Sleeker, opens locks like Electronic Lockpick, breaks after three uses.

Other Equipment.name: Flare
Other Equipment.description: Lit for 6 AP, creates bright red light in 30-foot radius and dim red light for additional 30 feet, lasts 1 hour.

Other Equipment.name: Flashlight
Other Equipment.description: Creates bright light in 20-foot cone and dim light for additional 20 feet for 1 AP. Lasts 8 hours with 6 AP to load an energy cell.

Other Equipment.name: Gas Mask
Other Equipment.description: While worn, radiation DC decreases by 3, passive sense decreases by 2.

Other Equipment.name: Geiger Counter
Other Equipment.description: Detects radiation levels and reveals radiation severity score in irradiated zones.

Other Equipment.name: Grappling Hook
Other Equipment.description: Metal hook tied to a rope with 6 AP.

Other Equipment.name: Hazmat Suit
Other Equipment.description: Lead-lined suit, takes 1 minute to don/doff, no armor over it. Radiation DC decreases by 10, immune to radiation damage, failing radiation checks doesn't increase DC. Gains 1 decay level per 5 HP damage, each decay increases radiation score by 1. Repair: crafting DC 12 (+2), x2 lead, x1 cloth.

Other Equipment.name: Hazmat Suit, Powered
Other Equipment.description: Includes Geiger counter, air purification, impact absorption, bulbous helmet. Requires 3 energy cells (6 AP, lasts 6 hours). Takes 30 seconds to don/doff, no armor with it. DT increases by 3, immune to radiation levels/damage. Gains 1 decay level per 5 HP damage, ceases function at 10 decay. Repair: crafting DC 15 (+5), x3 lead, x2 leather, x2 circuitry.

Other Equipment.name: Lockpicks
Other Equipment.description: Metal tools reducing breach skill check DC by 5, break after five uses.

Other Equipment.name: Rope
Other Equipment.description: Used to tie items, create pulleys, climb, or grapple (advantage on Strength rolls). AC 10, DT 2, 5 HP, vulnerable to ballistic, laser, plasma, slashing damage.

Other Equipment.name: Sleeping Bag
Other Equipment.description: Nylon, cloth, or hide bag for sleeping in rough terrain.

Other Equipment.name: Stealth Boy
Other Equipment.description: RobCo Stealth Boy 3001, activates for 3 AP, makes you invisible for 1 minute while on body, single use.

Other Equipment.name: Tent, one person
Other Equipment.description: Provides shelter from weather and terrain.

Other Equipment.name: Tent, two person
Other Equipment.description: Larger tent providing shelter from weather and terrain.

Other Equipment.name: Two-way Radio
Other Equipment.description: Militaristic devices for long-range communication. Functions for 100 activations per energy cell (6 AP to load). Activates for 3 AP, transmits sound within 5 feet to the other radio, audible within 5 feet. No sound if both activated simultaneously.

Other Equipment.name: Waterskin
Other Equipment.description: Leather pouch holding 60 oz. of liquid.

Other Equipment.name: Weapon Repair Kit
Other Equipment.description: Repairs 2 levels of weapon decay after 1 minute with 6 AP. Ceases function after three uses.

Food and Drink Properties.name: Addictive
Food and Drink Properties.description: If an Alcoholic drink also has this property, you must succeed an Endurance ability check of 5 or become addicted. While addicted and not under the effects, you have two levels of exhaustion. Addiction is lost after a number of weeks equal to 6 minus your Endurance ability modifier (minimum 1 week).

Food and Drink Properties.name: Alcoholic
Food and Drink Properties.description: If your Endurance score is 5 or higher, you become buzzed for 1d4 hours. If 4 or lower, you become drunk. Consuming another alcoholic or high-proof drink while buzzed makes you drunk for 1d4 hours. While drunk, two more alcoholic or high-proof drinks make you hammered for 1d4 hours. While hammered, two more make you wasted for 1d4 hours.

Food and Drink Properties.name: Caffeinated
Food and Drink Properties.description: Removes negative effects of the first three levels of exhaustion for 6 hours. If no exhaustion, adds 1 to d20 rolls. Drinking another while under effects grants 1 AP at the start of your turn for 6 hours, but at the end, you gain a level of exhaustion for each additional caffeinated drink consumed.

Food and Drink Properties.name: High-Proof
Food and Drink Properties.description: If your Endurance score is 5 or higher, you become drunk for 1d4 hours. If 4 or lower, you become hammered. Consuming another alcoholic or high-proof drink while drunk makes you hammered for 1d4 hours. While hammered, two more make you wasted for 1d4 hours.

Food and Drink Properties.name: Hydrating
Food and Drink Properties.description: Removes an additional two levels of dehydration (total of three with the base drink effect).

Food and Drink Properties.name: Irradiated
Food and Drink Properties.description: Consuming irradiated food gives you one irradiated level. Ten irradiated levels result in one level of rads.

Food and Drink Properties.name: Filling
Food and Drink Properties.description: Removes an additional level of hunger when consumed.

Food and Drink Properties.name: Bland
Food and Drink Properties.description: Heals stamina points equal to half your level.

Food and Drink Properties.name: Tasty
Food and Drink Properties.description: Heals stamina points equal to your level.

Food and Drink Properties.name: Flavorsome
Food and Drink Properties.description: Heals stamina points equal to double your level.

Food and Drink Properties.name: Delicacy
Food and Drink Properties.description: Heals stamina points equal to triple your level.

Food and Drink Properties.name: Fortifying
Food and Drink Properties.description: Decreases your radiation DC by 2 for 6 hours.

Food and Drink Properties.name: Energizing
Food and Drink Properties.description: Grants 1 AP at the start of your turn for 4 hours.

Food and Drink Properties.name: Empowering
Food and Drink Properties.description: Grants 2 AP at the start of your turn for 4 hours.

Food and Drink Properties.name: Regenerating
Food and Drink Properties.description: Heals hit points equal to your healing rate.

Food and Drink Properties.name: Refreshing
Food and Drink Properties.description: Removes one level of dehydration when consumed.

Food and Drink Properties.name: Snack
Food and Drink Properties.description: Does not remove hunger levels unless two foods with this property are consumed.

Food and Drink Properties.name: Spicy
Food and Drink Properties.description: Increases your DT by 3 against fire or laser damage for the next 6 hours.

Food and Drink Properties.name: Hearty
Food and Drink Properties.description: Increases your carry load by 50 for the next 6 hours.

Food and Drink Properties.name: Pungent
Food and Drink Properties.description: Increases your DT by 1 for the next 6 hours.

Food and Drink Properties.name: Putrid
Food and Drink Properties.description: Poisons you for 4 hours if your Endurance score is 5 or lower.

Food and Drink Properties.name: Cleansing
Food and Drink Properties.description: Cures one addiction.

Food and Drink Properties.name: Strengthening
Food and Drink Properties.description: Increases damage dealt by attacks by 2 for 6 hours.

Food and Drink Properties.name: Lucky
Food and Drink Properties.description: Grants advantage on all Luck ability checks for 6 hours.

Food and Drink Properties.name: Charged
Food and Drink Properties.description: Recycles all unspent AP at the beginning of each of your turns for the next hour.

Medicine.name: Antidote
Medicine.description: Usable over 15 minutes on yourself or a creature within 5 feet. Removes poisoned condition.

Medicine.name: Healing Powder
Medicine.description: Usable for 6 AP on yourself or an adjacent creature (human, mutant, abomination, animal, insect). Heals hit points equal to half their healing rate at the start of each turn for three rounds. Ineffective on ghouls, robots, gen-2 synths.

Medicine.name: RadAway
Medicine.description: Usable over 15 minutes on yourself or a creature within 5 feet. Removes two levels of radiation, adds one level of thirst.

Medicine.name: RadAway (Diluted)
Medicine.description: Usable over 15 minutes on yourself or a creature within 5 feet. Removes one level of radiation, adds one level of thirst.

Medicine.name: Rad-X
Medicine.description: Consumable for 3 AP, decreases radiation DC by 2 for 3 hours. Up to three can be consumed for cumulative benefits.

Medicine.name: RobCo Quick Fix-it 1.0
Medicine.description: Usable for 4 AP on yourself or an adjacent robot/gen-2 synth. Heals hit points equal to half their healing rate.

Medicine.name: RobCo Quick Fix-it 2.0
Medicine.description: Usable for 4 AP on yourself or an adjacent robot/gen-2 synth. Heals hit points equal to their healing rate.

Medicine.name: Extreme Damages RobCo Quick Fix-it 2.0
Medicine.description: Usable for 4 AP on yourself or an adjacent robot/gen-2 synth. Heals hit points equal to double their healing rate.

Medicine.name: Stimpak
Medicine.description: Usable for 4 AP on yourself or an adjacent creature (human, mutant, gen-2 synth, abomination, animal, insect). Heals hit points equal to their healing rate (half for ghouls).

Medicine.name: Stimpak (Diluted)
Medicine.description: Usable for 4 AP on yourself or an adjacent creature (human, mutant, gen-2 synth, abomination, animal, insect). Heals hit points equal to half their healing rate (quarter for ghouls).

Medicine.name: Super Stimpak
Medicine.description: Usable for 4 AP on yourself or an adjacent creature (human, mutant, gen-2 synth, abomination, animal, insect). Heals hit points equal to double their healing rate (full for ghouls).

Medicine.name: Auto-Inject Stimpak
Medicine.description: Automatically applies Stimpak effects when hit points are at or below half maximum.

Medicine.name: Auto-Inject Super Stimpak
Medicine.description: Automatically applies Super Stimpak effects when hit points are at or below half maximum.

Skill Magazines.name: Milsurp Review
Skill Magazines.description: Increases Guns skill bonus by 1 until you rest. Reading five issues permanently increases Guns skill bonus by 1.

Skill Magazines.name: Future Weapons Today
Skill Magazines.description: Increases Energy Weapons skill bonus by 1 until you rest. Reading five issues permanently increases Energy Weapons skill bonus by 1.

Skill Magazines.name: Patriot's Cookbook
Skill Magazines.description: Increases Explosives skill bonus by 1 until you rest. Reading five issues permanently increases Explosives skill bonus by 1.

Skill Magazines.name: Tæles of Chivalrie
Skill Magazines.description: Increases Melee Weapons skill bonus by 1 until you rest. Reading five issues permanently increases Melee Weapons skill bonus by 1.

Skill Magazines.name: Boxing Times
Skill Magazines.description: Increases Unarmed skill bonus by 1 until you rest. Reading five issues permanently increases Unarmed skill bonus by 1.

Skill Magazines.name: Today's Physician
Skill Magazines.description: Increases Medicine skill bonus by 1 until you rest. Reading five issues permanently increases Medicine skill bonus by 1.

Skill Magazines.name: Locksmith's Reader
Skill Magazines.description: Increases Breach skill bonus by 1 until you rest. Reading five issues permanently increases Breach skill bonus by 1.

Skill Magazines.name: Fixin’ Things
Skill Magazines.description: Increases Crafting skill bonus by 1 until you rest. Reading five issues permanently increases Crafting skill bonus by 1.

Skill Magazines.name: ¡La Fantoma!
Skill Magazines.description: Increases Sneak skill bonus by 1 until you rest. Reading five issues permanently increases Sneak skill bonus by 1.

Skill Magazines.name: Lad's Life
Skill Magazines.description: Increases Survival skill bonus by 1 until you rest. Reading five issues permanently increases Survival skill bonus by 1.

Skill Magazines.name: Salesman Weekly
Skill Magazines.description: Increases Barter skill bonus by 1 until you rest. Reading five issues permanently increases Barter skill bonus by 1.

Skill Magazines.name: Horror Comics
Skill Magazines.description: Increases Intimidation skill bonus by 1 until you rest. Reading five issues permanently increases Intimidation skill bonus by 1.

Skill Magazines.name: Meeting People
Skill Magazines.description: Increases Speech skill bonus by 1 until you rest. Reading five issues permanently increases Speech skill bonus by 1.

Skill Magazines.name: Programmer's Digest
Skill Magazines.description: Increases Science skill bonus by 1 until you rest. Reading five issues permanently increases Science skill bonus by 1.

Chem Properties.name: Anabolic
Chem Properties.description: Advantage on all Strength and Endurance ability and skill checks, and gain temporary hit points equal to your level.

Chem Properties.name: Anxiolytic
Chem Properties.description: Advantage on Charisma ability and skill checks, combat sequence rolls, and checks to resist becoming frightened.

Chem Properties.name: Extrapolating
Chem Properties.description: Advantage on all Intelligence and Perception ability and skill checks, but disadvantage on all Charisma ability and skill checks.

Chem Properties.name: Hallucinogenic
Chem Properties.description: Advantage on all Luck checks and may flip your karma cap.

Chem Properties.name: Hyperstimulant
Chem Properties.description: Gain 4 additional AP at the start of your turn (max 20), no longer suffer negative effects of the first eight levels of exhaustion. If no exhaustion, add 2 to d20 rolls. Immune to gaining levels of fatigue.

Chem Properties.name: Invigorating
Chem Properties.description: Regain stamina points equal to half your level.

Chem Properties.name: Psychosis
Chem Properties.description: When dealing damage from an attack roll, damage is increased by 5. You always attack the nearest hostile creature. If none are nearby, you must make an Endurance ability check of 15; on a failure, you attack the nearest creature.

Chem Properties.name: Sedative
Chem Properties.description: Your passive sense increases by 5, and if you critically hit with an attack roll, damage is increased by 10.

Chem Properties.name: Stimulant
Chem Properties.description: Gain 1 additional AP at the start of your turn (max 16), no longer suffer negative effects of the first three levels of exhaustion. If no exhaustion, add 1 to d20 rolls.

Chem Properties.name: Super Stimulant
Chem Properties.description: Gain 2 additional AP at the start of your turn (max 20), no longer suffer negative effects of the first five levels of exhaustion. If no exhaustion, add 2 to d20 rolls. Immune to gaining levels of fatigue.

Unique Items.name: Vault Suit
Unique Items.description: Form-fitting rubber and cloth jumpsuit with biometric sensors, heat-dissipation strip, and antenna. Functions as cloth armor with rank 1 Lead Lined, Reinforced, Fitted, and Sturdy upgrades.

Unique Items.name: Pip-Boy 2000
Unique Items.description: Wrist-mounted computer displaying maps, playing holotapes, tracking location, recording audio, inputting text notes. With Vault Suit (≤ 5 decay), heals additional hit points equal to your level.

Unique Items.name: Pip-Boy 2000 Mark VI
Unique Items.description: Basic Pip-Boy with heartbeat/electromagnetic sensor. For 2 AP, detects cardinal direction of creatures within 60 feet not covered by ≥ 1 foot lead/steel.

Unique Items.name: Pip-Boy 3000
Unique Items.description: Pip-Boy with Geiger counter, flashlight, and radio connection capabilities.

Unique Items.name: Pip-Boy 3000 Mark IV
Unique Items.description: Combines Pip-Boy 2000 Mark VI and 3000 features: heartbeat/electromagnetic sensor (2 AP, detects creatures within 60 feet not covered by ≥ 1 foot lead/steel), Geiger counter, flashlight, radio connection.

Unique Items.name: Electronic Lockpick
Unique Items.description: Attaches to a lock within 5 feet for 6 AP, opens at end of turn, breaks after one use.

Unique Items.name: Electronic Lockpick Mk II
Unique Items.description: Sleeker, opens locks like Electronic Lockpick, breaks after three uses.

Unique Items.name: Stealth Boy
Unique Items.description: RobCo Stealth Boy 3001, activates for 3 AP, makes you invisible for 1 minute while on body, single use.

Unique Items.name: Two-way Radio
Unique Items.description: Militaristic devices for long-range communication. Functions for 100 activations per energy cell (6 AP to load). Activates for 3 AP, transmits sound within 5 feet to the other radio, audible within 5 feet. No sound if both activated simultaneously.
